faqs.question: Can foreigners buy bien immobilier en Espagne?
faqs.answer: Yes, les étrangers peuvent freely purchase bien immobilier en Espagne without requiring Spanish citizenship or residency. The process requires obtaining a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), opening a Spanish bank account, and engaging a local solicitor. Most international buyers successfully complete purchases within 8-12 semaines. Legal protections and property rights are equivalent for foreign and Spanish owners.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying bien immobilier en Espagne?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect additional costs including transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (approximately 1%), property registration fees (0.1-0.5%), and legal representation (€500-1,500). Some properties require surveyor valuations and mortgage arrangement fees if financing. These additional costs typically total 8-13% of the property purchase price, though exact amounts vary by autonomous community and property value.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy bien immobilier en Espagne?
